Authors: Dodescu, A; Badulescu, A; Saveanu, T
Author Full Names: Dodescu, Anca; Badulescu, Alina; Saveanu, Tomina
Article Title: Beyond Entrepreneurial Education: The Access to Finance as Obstacle to Women Entrepreneurship in Western Romania
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 6TH EUROPEAN CONFERENCE ON INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP, VOL 1 AND 2
Conference Title: 6th European Conference on Innovation and Entrepreneurship (ECIE)
Author Keywords: women entrepreneurship; entrepreneurial education; business finance; business start-up; access to finance
Abstract: The aim of this paper is to distinguish between different factors of success as well as obstacles in women entrepreneurship development in the western part of Romania. Previous data on this topic showed that education and training has a double positive impact: as a success factor for a business (highly educated women tend to run bigger firms), as well as an element of promoting entrepreneurship among women. Nevertheless experience showed us that training is an important factor yet it does not act alone, and entrepreneurs, have to face several challenges that require different type of resources. The data presented in this paper are both quantitative and qualitative and are focused on the type and the effects of different problems which need to be solved by women entrepreneurs in the initiation and development of a business. Accordingly, the main research questions addressed in this paper are: which is the hierarchy of obstacles faced by women entrepreneurs comparatively at business start-up and after activity? Which are the main obstacles of women who intend to develop a business? How can these obstacles be overcome? The first part investigates different obstacles faced by women entrepreneurs in Western Romania, such as taxes, bureaucracy, instable legal frame work, competition and access to finance. Our study is based on the results of a survey conducted within the project Entrepreneurship and Equality of Chances. An Inter-regional Model of Entrepreneurship Training for Women in Western Romania - ANTRES (POSDRU/9/3.1/S/5). We have investigated two categories of women: first entrepreneurs from urban areas in the western part of Romania and second women who intend to start a business from urban and rural western Romania - over 2000 questionnaires were analyzed in this paper. The main conclusion of this section is that most problems that entrepreneurs have to overcome in order to develop their business can be addressed solely by governmental policies and support in access to finance and other resources. This last category of factors was especially emphasized by women who intend to start their own business from the project mentioned above, which were interviewed as a follow up survey. From these interviews, which are analyzed in the second section of this paper, we can state that the main obstacle in the decision to initiate one's own business is the lack of financial resources along with other aspects derived from the current economic context. Consequently, in the third part we addressed this last aspect, and added a new research question: Is the access to finance a real obstacle to entrepreneurship, especially for women entrepreneurship? This section is based on analysis derived from the joint EBRD - World Bank Business Environment and Enterprise Performance Survey (BEEPS) conducted in 2002 and 2005, as well as CEEDR 2000. This data supports the conclusion of our ANTRES survey, as business start-up finance is seen a major problem by most respondents, along with high tax rates.

Authors: Doicin, C; Rosu, M; Ionescu, N; Baila, D
Author Full Names: Doicin, C.; Rosu, M.; Ionescu, N.; Baila, D.
Article Title: DEVELOPING THE ENTREPRENEURIAL COMPETENCES FOR SETTING UP NEW SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS
Conference Title: 7th International Conference on Management of Technological Changes
Conference Sponsor: Democritus Univ Thrace,Gheorghe Asachi Tech Univ,Central & E European Management Dev Assoc,Ctr Continu Educ & Train,Region E Macedonia & Thrace
Abstract: Never in recent history have entrepreneurship been so vivid and the need for entrepreneurship education so great. Despite the risks and difficulties normally associated with the start-up of any business and despite the mishaps caused by economic and financial crisis, the new generation of entrepreneurs still finds the zest required to overcome obstacles and move forward. This paper describes a methodology for stimulating, promoting and disseminating the culture of entrepreneurship and the entrepreneurial spirit in South-East region through two projects financed from Structural Funds. The results of nearly two years of hard work have materialized in the setting up of new firms in Constanta and Galati and in the building of new structures designed to further support this endeavour.

Article Title: ECONOMICAL ASPECTS OF REPUTATION MECHANISMS ON ELECTRONIC MARKETS
Book Series Title: Schriftenreihe Informatik
Conference Title: 19th Interdisciplinarity Information Management Talks
Conference Sponsor: Bundesministerium Wissenschaft & Forschung,Grant Agcy Czech Republ,Univ Econ Prague,Johannes Kepler Univ Linz, Netzwerk Forschung, Lehre & Praxis,KIRAS Sicherheitsforschung

Abstract: Trust and trust building issues are very often discussed topics regarding electronic marketplaces. Reputation mechanisms are according to many studies the most trust generating mechanisms currently used on e-markets. Main objective of this paper is to identify the procurers' behavior on e-market providing reputation mechanism in form of rating and historical transactions information. For data gathering was used experimental approach based on Design of Experiment using web based platform. Results were in this stage analyzed using descriptive statistic and working hypotheses verified using simple statistical tests.

Authors: Farrington, S; Venter, E; Eybers, C; Boshoff, C
Author Full Names: Farrington, Shelley; Venter, Elmarie; Eybers, Carey; Boshoff, Christo
Article Title: TASK-BASED FACTORS INFLUENCING THE SUCCESSFUL FUNCTIONING OF COPRENEURIAL BUSINESSES IN SOUTH AFRICA
Source Title: SOUTH AFRICAN JOURNAL OF ECONOMIC AND MANAGEMENT SCIENCES
Author Keywords: copreneurs; husband-and-wife teams; successful copreneurial businesses; copreneurship as a route to entrepreneurship
Keywords Plus: WORK GROUP CHARACTERISTICS; PERFORMANCE; TEAMS; MODEL
Abstract: Globally, evidence exists to suggest that the number of copreneurial businesses or spousal partnerships are on the increase. The primary objectives of this study are to identify the task-based factors influencing the effectiveness of a copreneurial business, to propose a conceptual model based on these factors and to subject the model to empirical testing. The model is empirically tested among copreneurial businesses to assess potential relationships between selected independent variables (shared dream, leadership, personal needs alignment, division of labour, complementary skills, supportive employees, competencies and adequate resources) and measures of copreneurial success (perceived success and financial performance). In order to address the primary objective of this study, a questionnaire was administered to a sample of 1548 respondents (spouses in business together) of which 380 questionnaires were useable for statistical analysis. The empirical results revealed that apart from division of labour all the other factors investigated exert a significant influence on the successful functioning of copreneurial businesses.

Article Title: The Investigation of Possibility of the Use of Genetic Algorithm in Predicting Companies' Bankruptcy
Book Series Title: International Proceedings of Economics Development and Research
Conference Title: International Conference on Business and Economics Research (ICBER 2010)
Author Keywords: predicting bankruptcy; genetic algorithm; Tehran Stock Exchange; type 1 and 2 Error
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to predict the bankruptcy using genetic algorithm. So doing, having read the review of literature, the researchers found a complete list of financial proportions that showed high capabilities the predicting bankruptcy. These proportions include the ratio of operational income to sale, ratio of total debts of total assets; current assets to current debts; sale to current assets and interest cost to grass profit. Then the possibility of the use of the genetic algorithm in predicting the bankruptcy of the accepted companies in Tehran Stock Exchange was investigated. The independent t-test showed that there was a meaningful difference between the average of these ratios of bankrupted group with that of non-bankrupt one. The results of the statistical tests indicate that the genetic algorithm can be used of predict bankruptcy in Iran.

Article Title: Re-investigation of the long run relationship between money growth and inflation in Iran: An application of Bounds test approach to cointegration
Book Series Title: International Proceedings of Economics Development and Research
Conference Title: International Conference on Business and Economics Research (ICBER 2010)
Author Keywords: Money; Inflation; Bounds test; Iran
Abstract: This paper re-investigates the long-run relationship between money growth and inflation, for the period of 1989-2007 by using quarterly data of the Iranian economy. As standard unit root tests, such as Augmented Dickey Fuller (ADF) and Philips and Perron (PP) tests, are biased towards the null of a unit root in presence of structural breaks, we use Lee and Strazicich (2003) test to address this issue and test the null of unit roots. The result reveals that the variables under consideration are not in the same order of integration. Therefore to investigate the long-run relationship between variables under consideration, this paper applies the bounds test approach to cointegration. This method was developed by Pesaran et al. (2001) and can be applied irrespective of the order of integration of the variables. The results reveal that there is a long run relation among these variables and in the long run 1 percent increase in money growth cause to increase 72 percent in inflation rate, which means money is the most important variable that effect inflation in long run. Moreover we find that inflation was largely a monetary phenomenon, supporting quantity theory of money.

Article Title: Financial Market and Technological Innovation
Author Keywords: Financial market; innovation system; company innovation strategies
Abstract: This paper addresses the relationship between technological innovation and finance. The financial market must be regarded as one of the fundamental prerequisites of innovation, inasmuch as it is here that decisions are made on capital allocation to enterprises. However, less has been written on the interdependencies between the patterns of corporate finance and governance on the one hand and company innovation strategies on the other. The paper takes up these open questions. It analyses the transformation process of the German innovation system due to the dynamics of the financial market in the last decades. In conclusion, some general insight into the relationship between finance and innovation beyond the German context will be provided. The paper is based on an extensive literature research in the fields of economic sociology and innovation studies and the analysis of the public debate on the prospects of the current economic development.

Conference Title: International Symposium on Applied Economics, Business and Development

Abstract: Chinese current industrial development is in the medium-term, the current dominant industry structure is still industry with large consumption of energy. According to 'decoupling' and 're-hook' basic principles, based on economic development and energy consumption relative 'decoupled' and 're-hook' concept model, Chinese consumption amount to analyze the relationship and energy consumption. And the various stages of 'decoupling' the identification and analysis of the phenomenon. Studies suggest that in a certain stage of Chinese total consumption and energy consumption in the 'relative decoupling' and 'expansive re-hook'.

Article Title: Entrepreneurial Success Model of Services SMEs
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 6TH EUROPEAN CONFERENCE ON INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP, VOL 1 AND 2
Conference Title: 6th European Conference on Innovation and Entrepreneurship (ECIE)
Author Keywords: entrepreneurial success; psychological performance; entrepreneurial work engagement; psychological capital
Keywords Plus: WORK ENGAGEMENT; BUSINESS OWNERS; PERFORMANCE; BEHAVIOR; SATISFACTION; RESOURCES; FIRM
Abstract: This study examines entrepreneurial success at individual level of entrepreneurs as the function of mainly psychological state constructs. Entrepreneurial success is asserted to comprise of financial and psychological measures of performance. Financial and psychological measures of performance as criteria of entrepreneurial success demand variance of understanding regarding relationships with the driving factors. This is a quantitative research and uses questionnaire survey for data collection. Respondents are the founding-entrepreneurs of established services SMEs in Malaysia. Using hierarchical multiple regression analysis, several hypothesis are expected to show positive relationships among the constructs hopefully answering the research questions such as: 1) To what extent entrepreneurial success is the function of positive psychological states such as psychological capital and entrepreneurial work engagement?; and 2) To what extent service orientation is related to entrepreneurial work engagement, and subsequently to entrepreneurial success among services SMEs in Malaysia? Drawing on positive psychology, the study proposes that there are strong relationships between entrepreneurial success and entrepreneurial work engagement. Additionally, it is expected that psychological capital and service orientation contribute to entrepreneurial success through entrepreneurial work engagement. Among others, the limitation of this study is cross-sectional in approach. Simple random sampling is used to ensure a broad representation of the target population since generalizability of the entrepreneurial success measurements is expected to be relevant at least for services SME population in Malaysia. As a conclusion, entrepreneurial success model needs to be expanded to consider the important roles of psychological states in understanding entrepreneurial success at individual entrepreneur level.
